reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Training in support of the International Law Enforcement Academies (ILEA).. International Law Enforcement Academies (ILEA) Training 321B

description.narrative: Combat international narcotics production and trafficking; reduce the cultivation and production of drugs; prevent the resurgence of drug production; and limit the public health effects of the drug trade through international drug control and demand reduction, prevention and treatment projects.

This award strives to combat international narcotics production and trafficking; reduce the cultivation and production of drugs; prevent the resurgence of drug production; and limit the public health effects of the drug trade trhough international drug control and demand reduction, prevention and treatment projects. More specifically, this includes International Law Enforcement Academies (ILEA) training in Bangkok, Budapest, Gaborone, & San Salvador.. Award Description - DEA will provide training at the International Law Enforcement Academies..

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: Hungary is a strong ally in coalition operations, as demonstrated by its contribution of troops to North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) missions. U.S.~assistance to Hungary contributes to regional stability and helps maintain strong political support in Hungary for coalition operations, including a willingness to provide personnel, equipment, and other resources for such operations. U.S.~assistance will promote the continued development of a flexible, sustainable, and interoperable Hungarian military capable of meeting NATO commitments. U.S. assistance will advance defense reform, build capacity, and strengthen partnerships in the region to more effectively counter Russian aggression and other emerging threats.
